meanings.definition: To melt down and refine (metal) again.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith had to resmelt the old iron to make a new sword.
meanings.sent2: After making a mistake, she decided to resmelt the gold and start over.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy apprentice accidentally resmelted the same batch of silver twice!
meanings.sent4: He hoped to resmelt his failures into successes through hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat of the furnace allowed him to resmelt the metal into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The jeweler needed to resmelt the silver to create a new ring.
meanings.sent2: To fix the broken hinge, he had to resmelt the brass and reshape it.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally left the spoon in the pot, causing the metal to resmelt.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to resmelt the bronze to add more detail to the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat from the fire allowed him to resmelt the metal and start anew.

meanings.definition: To melt down and refine metal again.
meanings.sent1: The factory had to resmelt the aluminum to remove impurities.
meanings.sent2: In order to create a stronger alloy, they had to resmelt the steel.
meanings.sent3: The workers had to resmelt the copper to meet the quality standards.
meanings.sent4: The process to resmelt the metal required precise temperature control.
meanings.sent5: The foundry used special equipment to resmelt the metal and make it more durable.
